text:
I saw this is the most expensive query in our DB:
```        SELECT *
        FROM lapi_events_create create_evs
        WHERE
          create_evs.event_sequential_id = ANY($1::bigint[])
          AND NOT EXISTS (  -- check not archived as of snapshot in the same synchronizer
                SELECT 1
                FROM lapi_events_consuming_exercise consuming_evs
                WHERE
                  create_evs.contract_id = consuming_evs.contract_id
                  AND create_evs.synchronizer_id = consuming_evs.synchronizer_id```

elements.text: I saw this is the most expensive query in our DB:

SELECT *
        FROM lapi_events_create create_evs
        WHERE
          create_evs.event_sequential_id = ANY($1::bigint[])
          AND NOT EXISTS (  -- check not archived as of snapshot in the same synchronizer
                SELECT 1
                FROM lapi_events_consuming_exercise consuming_evs
                WHERE
                  create_evs.contract_id = consuming_evs.contract_id
                  AND create_evs.synchronizer_id = consuming_evs.synchronizer_id

My guess is that the request you're sending could have the incorrect filters by party set.

Hi Luigy,
It’s correct that a Commercial Agreement between Obsidian and DA has to be accepted on-ledger. I’ll ask internally what needs to be done before that can be set up.

elements.text:
Hi Luigy,
It’s correct that a Commercial Agreement between Obsidian and DA has to be accepted on-ledger. I’ll ask internally what needs to be done before that can be set up.

text: Thanks <@UU4AZ8EEQ>

elements.text: Thanks

text: Hi, looking at your account ...

elements.text: Hi, looking at your account ...

text:
We received your new reuqest for access case Yesterday at 1:33pm NZST however as I said in this info:
• Customer Support then contacts an internal party to gain permission to enable your access
• If they reply Yes, then you make an account on the DA JFrog platform
• Let us know when that has been done
• Customer Support then add you to the relevant Access Group(s)
• You resume the required workflow
... `Customer Support then contacts an internal party to gain permission to enable your access` ... we have contacted this other party but are now waiting for permission from them whether to proceed. Sorry it is the best we can do, however I will follow-up with them right now, and will keep you appraised.

elements.text: We received your new reuqest for access case Yesterday at 1:33pm NZST however as I said in this info:
Customer Support then contacts an internal party to gain permission to enable your access
If they reply Yes, then you make an account on the DA JFrog platform
Let us know when that has been done
Customer Support then add you to the relevant Access Group(s)
You resume the required workflow
Customer Support then contacts an internal party to gain permission to enable your access

... we have contacted this other party but are now waiting for permission from them whether to proceed. Sorry it is the best we can do, however I will follow-up with them right now, and will keep you appraised.

text: Understood - any insight on whom the internal party is? We can outreach on our end if helpful. Also do you have an anticipated timeframe for resource planning purposes?
